title: Destin Hood
text:
Destin Dwane Hood (born April 3, 1990) is an American professional <a href="baseball">baseball</a> <a href="outfielder">outfielder</a> who is a free agent. He has previously played in <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> (MLB) for the <a href="Miami%20Marlins">Miami Marlins</a>.
Career.
Hood attended <a href="St.%20Paul%27s%20Episcopal%20School">St. Paul's Episcopal School</a> in <a href="Mobile%2C%20Alabama">Mobile, Alabama</a>, where he played on the baseball and <a href="American%20football">football</a> team. In football, he was ranked by <a href="Rivals.com">Rivals.com</a> as a four-star recruit and was committed to the <a href="University%20of%20Alabama">University of Alabama</a> to play <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for the <a href="Alabama%20Crimson%20Tide%20football">Crimson Tide</a>.
Washington Nationals.
Hood was drafted by the <a href="Washington%20Nationals">Washington Nationals</a> in the second round of the <a href="2008%20Major%20League%20Baseball%20Draft">2008 Major League Baseball Draft</a>. He signed with the Nationals, forgoing football at Alabama. He made his professional debut that season for the <a href="Gulf%20Coast%20Nationals">Gulf Coast Nationals</a>. Hood spent 2009 with Gulf Coast and the <a href="Vermont%20Lake%20Monsters">Vermont Lake Monsters</a>. He spent 2010 with the <a href="Hagerstown%20Suns">Hagerstown Suns</a> and 2011 with the <a href="Potomac%20Nationals">Potomac Nationals</a>. In 2012, he played for the <a href="Auburn%20Doubledays">Auburn Doubledays</a> and <a href="Harrisburg%20Senators">Harrisburg Senators</a>. In 2013, he returned to Harrisburg. After returning to Harrisburg for a third straight year in 2014, he was promoted to the <a href="Syracuse%20Chiefs">Syracuse Chiefs</a> early in the season.
Cleveland Indians.
On December 12, 2014, Hood signed a minor league deal with the <a href="Cleveland%20Indians">Cleveland Indians</a> organization. He was released on July 15, 2015.
Philadelphia Phillies.
On July 17, 2015, signed a minor league deal with the <a href="Philadelphia%20Phillies">Philadelphia Phillies</a>. He elected free agency on November 7, 2015.
Miami Marlins.
Hood signed with the <a href="Miami%20Marlins">Miami Marlins</a> organization for the 2016 season. The Marlins promoted Hood to the major leagues on September 1, 2016. He recorded his first career hit with a 5th inning double off of <a href="Cleveland%20Indians">Indians</a> pitcher <a href="Carlos%20Carrasco%20%28baseball%29">Carlos Carrasco</a> He was outrighted to AAA on October 7, 2017. He elected free agency on November 6, 2017.
Texas Rangers.
Hood signed a minor league contract with the <a href="Texas%20Rangers%20%28baseball%29">Texas Rangers</a> on January 4, 2018, with an invite to spring training. He played for the Triple-A <a href="Round%20Rock%20Express">Round Rock Express</a> and Double-A <a href="Frisco%20RoughRiders">Frisco RoughRiders</a>, and elected free agency after the season.
Lancaster Barnstormers.
On February 13, 2019, Hood signed with the <a href="Lancaster%20Barnstormers">Lancaster Barnstormers</a> of the independent <a href="Atlantic%20League%20of%20Professional%20Baseball">Atlantic League of Professional Baseball</a>. He became a free agent following the season. Hood re-signed with the Barnstormers on March 2, 2020. Hood did not play in a game for Lancaster in 2020 due to the cancellation of the Atlantic League season because of the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. He became a free agent after the year.
Washington Nationals (second stint).
On May 12, 2021, Hood signed a minor league contract with the <a href="Washington%20Nationals">Washington Nationals</a> organization.
